title: "What is the significance of the battle between virtues and their opposites in the existence of things?"
first_phrase: In the preceding text, the author explains the fundamental principle of every existing thing, which is the struggle between every virtue and its opposite. This struggle is exemplified in the perpetual battle between light and shadow, the sun and the moon. The text concludes with the assertion that everything in the universe carries the potential to assimilate the First Virtue, Eā. This is because Eā, the creator and creature, exists in all things. The last 200 tokens go on to elaborate on how the Prima Virtù, contained in the voice of Eā, unites opposites and generates and multiplies in both. This is demonstrated through various symbols and artifacts in the sacred rituals of the temple. Moreover, everything in creation carries the potential to assimilate the First Virtue.
content: Questo stesso vuol dire l'anello del pontéfice formato e chiuso da due pietre, l'una di tenebre e l'altra di luce, volendo indicare che egli riunisce i contrari in una stessa unita'. Perciò' il volgare vede nella creazione tante diverse cose tra loro differenti, mentre chi studia la scienza.
last_phrase: In conclusion, the symbolic representation of the sacred garments and rituals of the temple, along with the ring of the pontiff, signifies the unity of opposites. Everything in creation holds the potential to assimilate with the first virtue, as Eā is the father and mother of all things. Understanding this vision of Eā's law in all visible things leads one on the path to pontificate, where all magic becomes possible.
